member.name: T:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType
member.summary: Represents file type. Provides methods to obtain list of all file types supported by GroupDocs.Merger, detect file type by extension etc.

list.item: Learn more about file formats supported by GroupDocs.Merger: Full list of supported document formats
Learn more about getting supported file types in code: How to get supported file formats in code

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.FileFormat
member.summary: File type name e.g. "Microsoft Word Document".

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.Extension
member.summary: Filename suffix (including the period ".") e.g. ".doc".

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.Unknown
member.summary: Represents unknown file type.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.VSSX
member.summary: Visio Stencil File (.vssx) are drawing stencils created with Microsoft Visio 2013 and above. The VSSX file format can be opened with Visio 2013 and above. Visio files are known for representation of a variety of drawing elements such as collection of shapes, connectors, flowcharts, network layout, UML diagrams, Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.VSDX
member.summary: Visio Drawing (.vsdx) represents Microsoft Visio file format introduced from Microsoft Office 2013 onwards. It was developed to replace the binary file format, .VSD, which is supported by earlier versions of Microsoft Visio. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.VSDM
member.summary: Visio Macro-Enabled Drawing (.vsdm) are drawing files created with Microsoft Visio application that supports macros. VSDM files are OPC/XML drawings that are similar to VSDX, but also provide the capability to run macros when the file is opened. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.VSTX
member.summary: Visio Drawing Template (.vstx) are drawing template files created with Microsoft Visio 2013 and above. These VSTX files provide starting point for creating Visio drawings, saved as .VSDX files, with default layout and settings. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.VSTM
member.summary: Visio Macro-Enabled Drawing Template (.vstm) are template files created with Microsoft Visio that support macros. Unlike VSDX files, files created from VSTM templates can run macros that are developed in Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) code. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.VSSM
member.summary: Visio Macro-Enabled Stencil File (.vssm) are Microsoft Visio Stencil files that support provide support for macros. A VSSM file when opened allows to run the macros to achieve desired formatting and placement of shapes in a diagram. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.VSX
member.summary: Visio Stencil XML File (.vsx) refers to stencils that consist of drawings and shapes that are used for creating diagrams in Microsoft Visio. VSX files are saved in XML file format and was supported till Visio 2013. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.VTX
member.summary: Visio Template XML File (.vtx) is a Microsoft Visio drawing template that is saved to disc in XML file format. The template is aimed to provide a file with basic settings that can be used to create multiple Visio files of the same settings. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.VDX
member.summary: Visio Drawing XML File (.vdx)is a drawing or chart created in Microsoft Visio, but saved in XML format have .VDX extension. A Visio drawing XML file is created in Visio software, which is developed by Microsoft. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.EPUB
member.summary: Open eBook File (.epub) are an e-book file format that provide a standard digital publication format for publishers and consumers. The format has been so common by now that it is supported by many e-readers and software applications. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.PS
member.summary: PostScript File (.ps)

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.HTML
member.summary: Hypertext Markup Language File (.html) is the extension for web pages created for display in browsers. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.MHT
member.summary: MHTML Web Archive (.mht) is a web page archive format that can be created by a number of different applications. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.MHTML
member.summary: MIME HTML File (.mhtml) is a web page archive format that can be created by a number of different applications. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.ONE
member.summary: OneNote Document (.one) files are created by Microsoft OneNote application. OneNote lets you gather information using the application as if you are using your draftpad for taking notes. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.PDF
member.summary: Portable Document Format File (.pdf) isa file format that was to introduced as a standard for representation of documents and other reference material in a format that is independent of application software, hardware as well as Operating System. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.XPS
member.summary: XML Paper Specification File (.xps) represents page layout files that are based on XML Paper Specifications created by Microsoft. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.TEX
member.summary: LaTeX Source Document (.tex) is a language that comprises of programming as well as mark-up features, used to typeset documents. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.PPT
member.summary: PowerPoint Presentation (.ppt) represents PowerPoint file that consists of a collection of slides for displaying as SlideShow. It specifies the Binary File Format used by Microsoft PowerPoint 97-2003. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.PPTX
member.summary: PowerPoint Open XML Presentation (.pptx) is a presentation file created with popular Microsoft PowerPoint application. Unlike the previous version of presentation file format PPT which was binary, the PPTX format is based on the Microsoft PowerPoint open XML presentation file format. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.PPS
member.summary: PowerPoint Slide Show (.pps) is a file created using Microsoft PowerPoint for Slide Show purpose. PPS file reading and creation is supported by Microsoft PowerPoint 97-2003. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.PPSX
member.summary: PowerPoint Open XML Slide Show (.ppsx) is a file created using Microsoft PowerPoint 2007 and above for Slide Show purpose. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.ODP
member.summary: OpenDocument Presentation (.odp) represents presentation file format used by OpenOffice.org in the OASISOpen standard. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.OTP
member.summary: OpenDocument Presentation Template (.otp) represents presentation template files created by applications in OASIS OpenDocument standard format. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.XLS
member.summary: Excel Spreadsheet (.xls) is a file that can be created by Microsoft Excel as well as other similar spreadsheet programs such as OpenOffice Calc or Apple Numbers. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.XLSX
member.summary: Microsoft Excel Open XML Spreadsheet (.xlsx) is a well-known format for Microsoft Excel documents that was introduced by Microsoft with the release of Microsoft Office 2007. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.XLSM
member.summary: Excel Open XML Macro-Enabled Spreadsheet (.xlsm) is a type of Spreasheet files that support macros. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.XLSB
member.summary: Excel Binary Spreadsheet (.xlsb) file format specifies the Excel Binary File Format, which is a collection of records and structures that specify Excel workbook content. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.CSV
member.summary: Comma Separated Values File (.csv) represents plain text files that contain records of data with comma separated values. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.TSV
member.summary: Tab Separated Values File (.tsv) represents data separated with tabs in plain text format. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.ODS
member.summary: OpenDocument Spreadsheet (.ods) Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.XLTM
member.summary: Excel Open XML Macro-Enabled Spreadsheet Template (.xltm) represents files that are generated by Microsoft Excel as Macro-enabled template files. XLTM files are similar to XLTX in structure other than that the later doesn't support creating template files with macros. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.XLTX
member.summary: Excel Open XML Spreadsheet Template (.xltx) files are based on the Office OpenXML file format specifications. It is used to create a standard template file that can be utilized to generate XLSX files that exhibit the same settings as specified in the XLTX file. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.XLT
member.summary: Excel Template File (.xlt) are template files created with Microsoft Excel which is a spreadsheet application which comes as part of Microsoft Office suite. Microsoft Office 97-2003 supported creating new XLT files as well as opening these. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.XLAM
member.summary: Excel Macro-Enabled Add-In (.xlam)

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.DOC
member.summary: Microsoft Word Document (.doc) represent documents generated by Microsoft Word or other word processing documents in binary file format. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.DOCX
member.summary: Microsoft Word Open XML Document (.docx) is a well-known format for Microsoft Word documents. Introduced from 2007 with the release of Microsoft Office 2007, the structure of this new Document format was changed from plain binary to a combination of XML and binary files. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.DOCM
member.summary: Word Open XML Macro-Enabled Document (.docm) files are Microsoft Word 2007 or higher generated documents with the ability to run macros. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.DOT
member.summary: Word Document Template (.dot) files are template files created by Microsoft Word to have pre-formatted settings for generation of further DOC or DOCX files. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.DOTX
member.summary: Word Open XML Document Template (.dotx) are template files created by Microsoft Word to have pre-formatted settings for generation of further DOCX files. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.DOTM
member.summary: Word Open XML Macro-Enabled Document Template (.dotm) represents template file created with Microsoft Word 2007 or higher. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.RTF
member.summary: Rich Text Format File (.rtf) introduced and documented by Microsoft, the Rich Text Format (RTF) represents a method of encoding formatted text and graphics for use within applications. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.TXT
member.summary: Plain Text File (.txt) represents a text document that contains plain text in the form of lines. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.ERR
member.summary: Error Log File (.err) is a text file that contains error messages generated by a program. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.ODT
member.summary: OpenDocument Text Document (.odt) files are type of documents created with word processing applications that are based on OpenDocument Text File format. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Merger.Domain.FileType.OTT
member.summary: OpenDocument Document Template (.ott) represent template documents generated by applications in compliance with the OASIS' OpenDocument standard format. Learn more about this file format here.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Merger.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
The namespace provides classes which allow you to merge documents and manipulate document structure (split single document to multiple documents, reorder or replace document pages, change page orientation, manage document password and perform other manipulations) across wide range of supported document types - PDF, DOCX/DOC, PPTX/PPT, XLSX/XLS, VSDX/VSD, ODT, ODS, ODP, HTML, EPUB and many others.
The main classes in this namespace are:
is the entry point for merging process.
provides an easy way to customize loging behaviour and etc.
